DataElement.preferredName: Menstrual Cycle End Reason Due To Surgery Data Unknown Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A checkbox for information related to the reason the menstrual cycle ends due to surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Menstrual Cycle End Reason Due To Surgery
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The reason the Menstrual Cycle involving regularly recurring hormonal changes and physiologic endometrial changes during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminates in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization ends._The permanent cessation of menses, usually defined by 6 to 12 months of amenorrhea in a woman over 45 years of age._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action._A procedure to remove or repair a part of the body or to find out whether disease is present.  An operation._Caused by or resulting from.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Regularly recurring physiologic changes in the endometrium during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminating in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization. The hormonal changes that lead up to a woman's having a period. For most women, one cycle takes 28 days.

Concepts.definition: The Menstrual Cycle involves regularly recurring hormonal changes and physiologic endometrial changes during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminates in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization. For most women, one cycle takes 28 days. (NCI)

Property.preferredDefinition: The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.:Caused by or resulting from.:A procedure to remove or repair a part of the body or to find out whether disease is present.  An operation.

Concepts.definition: The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
A procedure to remove or repair a part of the body or to find out whether disease is present.  An operation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's ability to conceive or nurse offspring and/or their current reproductive status.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a single character text field to record data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
